column1: 1 ^ Confitēminī Dominō quoniam bonus
column2: quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus. ^ Give glory to the Lord
column3: for he is good
column4: for his mercy endureth for ever.

column1: 2 ^ Quis loquētur potentiās Dominī
column2: audītās faciet omnēs laudēs ejus? ^ Who shall declare the powers of the Lord
column3: shall set forth all his praises?

column1: 3 ^ Beātī quī cūstōdiunt jūdicium
column2: et faciunt jūstitiam in omnī tempore. ^ Blessed are they that keep judgment
column3: and do justice at all times.

column1: 4 ^ Mementō nostrī
column2: Domine
column3: in benēplacitō populī tuī; vīsitā nōs in salūtārī tuō
column6: in the favour of thy people; visit us with thy salvation

column1: 5 ^ ad videndum in bonitāte ēlectōrum tuōrum
column2: ad laetandum in laetitiā gentis tuae
column3: ut laudēris cum hērēditāte tuā. ^ that we may see the good of thy chosen
column4: that we may rejoice in the joy of thy nation
column5: that thou mayst be praised with thy inheritance.

column1: 6 ^ Peccāvimus cum patribus nostrīs; injūstē ēgimus; inīquitātem fēcimus. ^ We have sinned with our fathers; we have acted unjustly; we have wrought iniquity.
7 ^ Patrēs nostrī in Aegiptō nōn intellēxērunt mīrābilia tua; nōn fuērunt memorēs multitūdinis misericordiae tuae
column2: et irrītāvērunt ascendentēs in mare
column3: mare Rubrum. ^ Our fathers understood not thy wonders in Egypt; they remembered not the multitude of thy mercies
column4: and they provoked to wrath going up to the sea

column1: 8 ^ Et salvāvit eōs propter nōmen suum
column2: ut nōtam faceret potentiam suam. ^ And he saved them for his own name's sake
column3: that he might make his power known.

column1: 9 ^ Et increpuit mare Rubrum et exsiccātum est
column2: et dēdūxit eōs in abissīs sīcut in dēsertō. ^ And he rebuked the Red Sea and it was dried up
column3: and he led them through the depths as in a wilderness.

column1: 10 ^ Et salvāvit eōs dē manū odientium
column2: et redēmit eōs dē manū inimīcī. ^ And he saved them from the hand of them that hated them
column3: and he redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.

column1: 11 ^ Et operuit aqua trībulantēs eōs; ūnus ex eīs nōn remansit. ^ And the water covered them that afflicted them; there was not one of them left.
12 ^ Et crēdidērunt verbīs ejus
column2: et laudāvērunt laudem ejus. ^ And they believed his words
column3: and they sang his praises.

column1: 13 ^ Cito fēcērunt; oblītī sunt operum ejus
column2: et nōn sustinuērunt consilium ejus. ^ Quickly they had done; they forgot his works
column3: and they waited not for his counsel.

column1: 14 ^ Et concupīvērunt concupiscentiam in dēsertō
column2: et tentāvērunt Deum in inaquōsō. ^ And they coveted their desire in the desert
column3: and they tempted God in the place without water.

column1: 15 ^ Et dedit eīs petītiōnem ipsōrum
column2: et mīsit saturitātem in animās eōrum. ^ And he gave them their request
column3: and sent fulness into their souls.

column1: 16 ^ Et irrītāvērunt Mōsem in castrīs; Aarōnem
column2: sanctum Dominī. ^ And they provoked Moses in the camp; Aaron
column3: the holy one of the Lord.

column1: 17 ^ Aperta est terra
column2: et dēgluttīvit Datanem
column3: et operuit super congregātiōnem Abīrōnis. ^ The earth opened
column5: and covered the congregation of Abiron.

column1: 18 ^ Et exarsit ignis in sinagōgā eōrum; flamma combussit peccātōrēs. ^ And a fire was kindled in their congregation; the flame burned the wicked.
19 ^ Et fēcērunt vitulum in Horeb
column2: et adōrāvērunt sculptile. ^ They made also a calf in Horeb
column3: and they adored the graven thing.

column1: 20 ^ Et mūtāvērunt glōriam suam in similitūdinem vitulī comedentis foenum. ^ And they changed their glory into the likeness of a calf that eateth grass.
21 ^ Oblītī sunt Deum quī salvāvit eōs; quī fēcit magnālia in Aegiptō
column2: ^ They forgot God who saved them; who had done great things in Egypt

column1: 22 ^ mīrābilia in terrā Cham
column2: terribilia in marī Rubrō. ^ wondrous works in the land of Cham
column3: terrible things in the Red Sea.

column1: 23 ^ Et dīxit ut disperderet eōs
column2: sī nōn Mōsēs ēlectus ejus stetisset in confractiōne in conspectū ejus
column3: ut āverteret īram ejus nē disperderet eōs. ^ And he said that he would destroy them
column4: had not Moses his chosen stood before him in the breach

column1: 24 ^ Et prō nihilō habuērunt terram dēsīderābilem; nōn crēdidērunt verbō ejus. ^ And they set at nought the desirable land; they believed not his word.
25 ^ Et murmurāvērunt in tabernāculīs suīs; nōn exaudīvērunt vōcem Dominī. ^ And they murmured in their tents; they hearkened not to the voice of the Lord.
26 ^ Et ēlevāvit manum suam super eōs
column2: ut prōsterneret eōs in dēsertō. ^ And he lifted up his hand over them
column3: to overthrow them in the desert.

column1: 27 ^ Et ut dējiceret sēmen eōrum in Nātiōnibus
column2: et dispergeret eōs in regiōnibus. ^ And to cast down their seed among the nations
column3: and to scatter them in the countries.

column1: 28 ^ Et initiātī sunt Baalfegor
column2: et comēdērunt sacrificia mortuōrum. ^ They also were initiated to Beelphegor
column3: and ate the sacrifices of the dead.

column1: 29 ^ Et irrītāvērunt eum in adinventiōnibus suīs
column2: et multiplicāta est in eīs ruīna. ^ And they provoked him with their inventions
column3: and destruction was multiplied among them.

column1: 30 ^ Et stetit Phinees et plācāvit
column2: et cessāvit quassātiō. ^ Then Phinehas stood up and made appeasement
column3: and the slaughter ceased.

column1: 31 ^ Et reputātum est eī in jūstitiam
column2: in generātiōnem et generātiōnem usque in sempiternum. ^ And it was reputed to him unto justice
column3: to generation and generation for evermore.

column1: 32 ^ Et irrītāvērunt eum ad Aquās Contrādictiōnis
column2: et vexātus est Mōsēs propter eōs
column3: ^ They provoked him also at the waters of contradiction
column4: and Moses was afflicted for their sakes

column1: 33 ^ quia exacerbāvērunt spīritum ejus
column2: et distīnxit in labiīs suīs. ^ because they exasperated his spirit
column3: and he distinguished with his lips.

column1: 34 ^ Nōn disperdidērunt gentēs quās dīxit Dominus illīs. ^ They did not destroy the nations of which the Lord spoke unto them.
35 ^ Et commixtī sunt inter Gentēs
column2: et didicērunt opera eōrum
column3: ^ And they were mingled among the heathens

column1: 36 ^ et servīvērunt sculptilibus eōrum
column2: et factum est illīs in scandalum. ^ and served their idols
column3: and it became a stumblingblock to them.

column1: 37 ^ Et immolāvērunt fīliōs suōs
column2: et fīliās suās daemoniīs. ^ And they sacrificed their sons
column3: and their daughters to devils.

column1: 38 ^ Et effūdērunt sanguinem innocentem
column2: sanguinem fīliōrum suōrum et fīliārum suārum quās sacrificāvērunt sculptilibus Chanaānis
column3: et infecta est terra in sanguinibus. ^ And they shed innocent blood
column4: the blood of their sons and of their daughters which they sacrificed to the idols of Chanaan
column5: and the land was polluted with blood.

column1: 39 ^ Et contāmināta est in operibus eōrum
column2: et fornicātī sunt in adinventiōnibus suīs. ^ And it was defiled with their works
column3: and they went aside after their own inventions.

column1: 40 ^ Et īrātus est furōre Dominus in populum suum
column2: et abōminātus est hērēditātem suam. ^ And the Lord was exceedingly angry with his people
column3: and he abhorred his inheritance.

column1: 41 ^ Et trādidit eōs in manūs gentium
column2: et dominātī sunt eōrum quī ōdērunt eōs. ^ And he delivered them into the hands of the nations
column3: and they that hated them had dominion over them.

column1: 42 ^ Et trībulāvērunt eōs inimīcī eōrum
column2: et humiliātī sunt sub manibus eōrum. ^ And their enemies afflicted them
column3: and they were humbled under their hands.

column1: 43 ^ Saepe līberāvit eōs; ipsī autem exacerbāvērunt eum in consiliō suō
column2: et humiliātī sunt in inīquitātibus suīs. ^ Many times did he deliver them; however they provoked him with their counsel
column3: and they were brought low by their iniquities.

column1: 44 ^ Et vīdit quum trībulārentur
column2: et audīvit ōrātiōnem eōrum. ^ And he saw when they were in tribulation
column3: and he heard their prayer.

column1: 45 ^ Et memor fuit testāmentī suī
column2: et poenituit eum secundum multitūdinem misericordiae suae. ^ And he was mindful of his covenant
column3: and repented according to the multitude of his mercies.

column1: 46 ^ Et dedit eōs in misericordiās in conspectū omnium quī cēperant eōs. ^ And he gave them unto mercies
column2: in the sight of all those that had made them captives.

column1: 47 ^ Salvōs fac nōs
column2: Domine Deus noster
column3: et congregā nōs dē nātiōnibus
column5: et glōriēmur in laude tuā. ^ Save us
column7: and gather us from among the nations
column8: that we may give thanks to thy holy name
column9: and may glory in thy praise.

column1: 48 ^ Benedictus Dominus Deus Isrāēlis
column2: ā saeculō et usque in saeculum. Et dīcet omnis populus: Fīat
column3: fīat. ^ Blessed be the Lord the God of Israel
column4: from everlasting to everlasting. And let all the people say: So be it
